verses.kjv: Then went Boaz up to the gate, and sat him down there: and, behold, the kinsman of whom Boaz spake came by; unto whom he said, Ho, such a one! turn aside, sit down here. And he turned aside, and sat down.
verses.web: Now Boaz went up to the gate and sat down there. Behold, the near kinsman of whom Boaz spoke came by. Boaz said to him, “Come over here, friend, and sit down!” He came over, and sat down.
verses.ct: Boaz went up to the town gate and sat down there. Sure enough, the closer relative he had mentioned came walking by. Boaz called out, "Friend, come sit down here!" So the man came over and sat down.

verses.kjv: And he took ten men of the elders of the city, and said, Sit ye down here. And they sat down.
verses.web: Boaz took ten men of the elders of the city, and said, “Sit down here,” and they sat down.
verses.ct: Then Boaz gathered 10 of the town's elders and said, "Please, sit down here." They sat down.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the kinsman, Naomi, that is come again out of the country of Moab, selleth a parcel of land, which was our brother Elimelech’s:
verses.web: He said to the near kinsman, “Naomi, who has come back out of the country of Moab, is selling the parcel of land, which was our brother Elimelech’s.
verses.ct: Boaz said to the closer relative, "Naomi, who has come back from Moab, is selling the piece of land that belonged to our relative Elimelech.

verses.kjv: And I thought to advertise thee, saying, Buy it before the inhabitants, and before the elders of my people. If thou wilt redeem it, redeem it: but if thou wilt not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know: for there is none to redeem it beside thee; and I am after thee. And he said, I will redeem it.
verses.web: I thought I should tell you, saying, ‘Buy it before those who sit here, and before the elders of my people.’ If you will redeem it, redeem it; but if you will not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know. For there is no one to redeem it besides you; and I am after you.” He said, “I will redeem it.”
verses.ct: I wanted to bring this to your attention and say: buy it here in front of these witnesses and the elders of our people. If you're willing to redeem it, go ahead. But if not, tell me now, because you have the first right to buy it, and I'm next in line." The man said, "I'll redeem it."

verses.kjv: Then said Boaz, What day thou buyest the field of the hand of Naomi, thou must buy it also of Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance.
verses.web: Then Boaz said, “On the day you buy the field from the hand of Naomi, you must buy it also from Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance.”
verses.ct: Then Boaz said, "The day you buy the field from Naomi, you also take on Ruth the Moabitess, the dead man's wife, so that his name will be carried on through his inheritance."

verses.kjv: And the kinsman said, I cannot redeem it for myself, lest I mar mine own inheritance: redeem thou my right to thyself; for I cannot redeem it.
verses.web: The near kinsman said, “I can’t redeem it for myself, lest I endanger my own inheritance. Take my right of redemption for yourself; for I can’t redeem it.”
verses.ct: The closer relative said, "Then I can't redeem it — that would put my own inheritance at risk. You take my right of redemption. I can't do it."

verses.kjv: Now this was the manner in former time in Israel concerning redeeming and concerning changing, for to confirm all things; a man plucked off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbour: and this was a testimony in Israel.
verses.web: Now this was the custom in former time in Israel concerning redeeming and concerning exchanging, to confirm all things: a man took off his sandal, and gave it to his neighbor; and this was the way of formalizing transactions in Israel.
verses.ct: Now in those days, it was the custom in Israel that when a deal involving redemption or exchange was finalized, one man would take off his sandal and hand it to the other. This was how transactions were made official in Israel.

verses.kjv: Therefore the kinsman said unto Boaz, Buy it for thee. So he drew off his shoe.
verses.web: So the near kinsman said to Boaz, “Buy it for yourself,” then he took off his sandal.
verses.ct: So the closer relative told Boaz, "Buy it yourself," and he pulled off his sandal.

verses.kjv: And Boaz said unto the elders, and unto all the people, Ye are witnesses this day, that I have bought all that was Elimelech’s, and all that was Chilion’s and Mahlon’s, of the hand of Naomi.
verses.web: Boaz said to the elders and to all the people, “You are witnesses today, that I have bought all that was Elimelech’s, and all that was Chilion’s and Mahlon’s, from the hand of Naomi.
verses.ct: Boaz announced to the elders and everyone present, "You are all witnesses today that I have purchased from Naomi everything that belonged to Elimelech, Chilion, and Mahlon.

verses.kjv: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, have I purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance, that the name of the dead be not cut off from among his brethren, and from the gate of his place: ye are witnesses this day.
verses.web: Moreover, Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, I have purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance, that the name of the dead may not be cut off from among his brothers and from the gate of his place. You are witnesses today.”
verses.ct: I have also taken Ruth the Moabitess, Mahlon's widow, as my wife, so that the dead man's name will be carried on through his inheritance and will not disappear from among his family or from this town. You are all witnesses today."

verses.kjv: And all the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, We are witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:
verses.web: All the people who were in the gate, and the elders, said, “We are witnesses. May LORD make the woman who has come into your house like Rachel and like Leah, which both built the house of Israel; and treat you worthily in Ephrathah, and be famous in Bethlehem.
verses.ct: All the people at the gate and the elders said, "We are witnesses! May the LORD make this woman coming into your home like Rachel and Leah, the two who built up the house of Israel. May you prosper in Ephrathah and become famous in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And let thy house be like the house of Pharez, whom Tamar bare unto Judah, of the seed which the LORD shall give thee of this young woman.
verses.web: Let your house be like the house of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, of the offspring which LORD will give you by this young woman.”
verses.ct: May your family be like the family of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, through the children the LORD gives you by this young woman."

verses.kjv: So Boaz took Ruth, and she was his wife: and when he went in unto her, the LORD gave her conception, and she bare a son.
verses.web: So Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife; and he went in to her, and LORD enabled her to conceive, and she bore a son.
verses.ct: So Boaz married Ruth. He slept with his wife, and the LORD enabled her to become pregnant, and she gave birth to a son.

verses.kjv: And the women said unto Naomi, Blessed be the LORD, which hath not left thee this day without a kinsman, that his name may be famous in Israel.
verses.web: The women said to Naomi, “Blessed be LORD, who has not left you today without a near kinsman. Let his name be famous in Israel.
verses.ct: The women of the town said to Naomi, "Praise the LORD! He hasn't left you without a family redeemer today. May this child's name become famous in Israel.

verses.kjv: And he shall be unto thee a restorer of thy life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than seven sons, hath born him.
verses.web: He shall be to you a restorer of life and sustain you in your old age; for your daughter-in-law, who loves you, who is better to you than seven sons, has given birth to him.”
verses.ct: He will bring life back to your soul and take care of you in your old age. After all, your daughter-in-law who loves you has given birth to him — and she has been better to you than 7 sons."

verses.kjv: And Naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became nurse unto it.
verses.web: Naomi took the child, laid him in her bosom, and became nurse to him.
verses.ct: Naomi took the baby, held him close to her chest, and cared for him.

verses.kjv: And the women her neighbours gave it a name, saying, There is a son born to Naomi; and they called his name Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.
verses.web: The women, her neighbors, gave him a name, saying, “A son is born to Naomi”. They named him Obed. He is the father of Jesse, the father of David.
verses.ct: The neighborhood women gave him a name, saying, "Naomi has a son!" They named him Obed. He became the father of Jesse, who became the father of David.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Pharez: Pharez begat Hezron,
verses.web: Now this is the history of the generations of Perez: Perez became the father of Hezron,
verses.ct: Here is the family line of Perez: Perez was the father of Hezron.

verses.kjv: And Hezron begat Ram, and Ram begat Amminadab,
verses.web: and Hezron became the father of Ram, and Ram became the father of Amminadab,
verses.ct: Hezron was the father of Ram, and Ram was the father of Amminadab.

verses.kjv: And Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,
verses.web: and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon became the father of Salmon,
verses.ct: Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon was the father of Salmon.

verses.kjv: And Salmon begat Boaz, and Boaz begat Obed,
verses.web: and Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed,
verses.ct: Salmon was the father of Boaz, and Boaz was the father of Obed.

verses.kjv: And Obed begat Jesse, and Jesse begat David.
verses.web: and Obed became the father of Jesse, and Jesse became the father of David.
verses.ct: Obed was the father of Jesse, and Jesse was the father of David.
